summary: Recent advances in biocatalysis include improved protein engineering tools and methods for stabilizing biocatalysts, which have broadened the application of synthetic chemistry. However, challenges such as the lack of designability and stability remain.
key_claims: Significant progress has been made in novel protein engineering tools and rational models for stabilizing biocatalysts.
These advancements have expanded the toolbox for synthetic chemistry.
